newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Formulab buys electric contracting firm.
newsitem.headline: Formulab buys electric contracting firm.

text.p: Computer group Formulab Neuronetics Corp Ltd said on Wednesday it had bought electrical contracting business Cavlec Electrical Engineering Services Pty Ltd for A$3.4 million with a mixture of cash and shares.

Formulab said Cavlec acquisition would provide a solid commercial and financial base from which to grow a presence in the market sectors identified by its advisers as the largest and potentially most lucrative for Formulab's Neuronetic technology. It said the group's technology is suited for the design of intelligent process control environments and for systems integration and automation of manufacturing/mining processes.

Formulab said Cavlec is one of the largest privately-owned, electrical contracting companies in Western Australia, providing services to the mining, manufacturing, petrochemical, oil, gas and the construction sector within Australia and overseas.
Cavlec group's revenue for the current financial year is expected to exceed A$10 million, Formulab said.
